summary: The Fire Weather Development Act of 2025 directs the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) to improve fire weather forecasting, detection, and collaboration. It establishes a program to enhance forecasts, warnings, and communication of wildfire-related information. The bill calls for research, development, and testing of tools and technologies, including the use of unmanned aircraft systems, and coordination with various stakeholders. It also creates an Interagency Coordinating Committee on Wildfires and a National Advisory Committee on Wildfires, along with a fire weather testbed. The bill addresses incident meteorologist workforce challenges and includes provisions for overtime pay. Research into wildland fire communications and information dissemination is also mandated.
